docs.lead_paragraph: A dispute about just what takes place in the street outside abortion providers — harassment or counseling? — will escalate with a change to a law regulating the activity.

docs.lead_paragraph: The 9-year-old girl had been raped by her father. She was 18 weeks pregnant. Carrying the baby to term, going through labor and delivery, would have ripped her small body apart.
docs.abstract: The murder of Dr. George Tiller demonstrates how important it is to strictly enforce all laws against harassment of abortion providers.
docs.snippet: The murder of Dr. George Tiller demonstrates how important it is to strictly enforce all laws against harassment of abortion providers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Flowers are being left outside the Reformation Lutheran Church in Wichita this week, and at the gated entrance of the Women's Health Care Services there - all in memory of George Tiller, one of the few doctors in the country who would still help women who needed abortions late in their pregnancies, and who was murdered on Sunday in the foyer of his longtime church.

headline.main: Patients Pay Tribute to a Murdered Doctor

docs.abstract: Tributes to the doctor who was murdered in Kansas are piling up, both in person and online.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the deaths of two New Yorkers — both in their 40s — the city’s Department of Health and Mental Hygiene said the number of fatalities related to swine flu rose to seven.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 5:27 p.m. | Two more deaths linked to swine flu -- both of adults in their early to mid-40s -- were reported by the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene on Wednesday, bringing the total H1N1-related fatalities in the city to seven.

headline.main: 2 More Deaths in City Linked to Swine Flu

docs.lead_paragraph: Last week, new guidelines urged women to be more vigilant about weight gain during pregnancy. While much of the focus is on women who gain too much weight during pregnancy, health officials estimate that about 20 percent of pregnant women don't gain enough weight, which can lead to premature delivery, low birth weight and long-term health problems for the baby.
docs.abstract: Most women gain too much weight during pregnancy, but some women don't gain nearly enough, putting the health of their baby at risk.
docs.snippet: Most women gain too much weight during pregnancy, but some women don't gain nearly enough, putting the health of their baby at risk.

docs.lead_paragraph: A British research firm is reporting that the average weight gained during pregnancy is 14 pounds -- and that's by the babies' fathers.
docs.abstract: Dads who swell with more than pride during pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Dads who swell with more than pride during pregnancy.
